qas.question: What is the name of the world-famous insurance market based in London?
What is the largest industry in London?
What is the UK's central bank known as?
Prior to mid-2007, approximately how many people in London had jobs in the financial sector?
How many banks does London operate overseas?

context: London's largest industry is <a1_0>finance<a1_0/>, and its financial exports make it a large contributor to the UK's balance of payments. Around <a3_0>325,000<a3_0/> people were employed in financial services in London until mid-2007. London has over <a4_0>480<a4_0/> overseas banks, more than any other city in the world. Over 85 percent (3.2 million) of the employed population of greater London works in the services industries. Because of its prominent global role, London's economy had been affected by the Late-2000s financial crisis. However, by 2010 the City has recovered; put in place new regulatory powers, proceeded to regain lost ground and re-established London's economic dominance. The City of London is home to <a2_0>the Bank of England<a2_0/>, London Stock Exchange, and <a0_0>Lloyd's of London<a0_0/> insurance market.
